scenes.background: You are on annual leave, enjoying some well-deserved time off to recharge. However, during your time away, a colleague messages you privately, saying there’s an urgent task that needs immediate attention. The request creates a dilemma as you try to balance respecting your time off while feeling the pressure to help with the urgent task. You decided to help your colleague Mark this time but asked him to handle such tasks without you while you are on leave. Now, a few hours later, you find yourself discussing this situation with Monica and Bob. [Monica] crossed her arms and sighed, while [Bob] leaned against the wall, looking thoughtful. [Monica] said, 'I can't believe Mark asked you to work during your leave. That's so inconsiderate.' [Bob] replied, 'Yeah, but sometimes work emergencies happen. How did you handle it, Alex?' You responded by saying you told Mark you’d help this time but asked him to handle such tasks without you in the future.
scenes.description: [Monica]: 'I still think it's unfair that Mark put you in that position. Do you think it was the right call?' [Bob] nodded in agreement with Monica, 'Yeah, it sounds like a tough spot to be in.'

options.text: I guess it was a judgment call. Sometimes you just have to go with the flow.
options.analysis: You gave an abstract response, showing balanced emotional intelligence but not strongly committing to any particular stance.

options.text: Maybe, but I think it's important to set boundaries and ensure they are respected. Otherwise, it sets a bad precedent.
options.analysis: You leaned towards agreement with Monica's point, showing strong self-regulation and emotional perception but lower empathy.

options.text: Well, I did agree to help, so it's not entirely Mark's fault. But he should have known better.
options.analysis: You offered a passive-aggressive response, indicating a mix of empathy and social skills but lower self-regulation.
